H1.content:
### 💡 Hints

**Hint 1:** Make sure you click on the tab called **"Issues"** at the top of the page.

H2.content:
### 💡 Hints

**Hint 2:** Make sure you count the right number of Open issues. Enter the number of open issues in the comment box.

H1.content:
### 💡 Hints

**Hint 1:** Look for a tab labeled **"Pull requests"** ✉️ at the top of the repository page.

H2.content:
### 💡 Hints

**Hint 2:** Focus on counting only the **OPEN** pull requests listed there.

H1.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 1:**  Look for a button labeled "Fork" on the main page of the repository.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 2:** The Fork button is typically found in one of the **four corners** of the main repository page.

H1.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 1:**  The **README** contents are usually below the file listing on the main page.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 2:**  Look for the section heading that **matches** one of the answers.

H1.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 1:**  The **contributors** can be found under the **"Insights"** tab which is usually between the "Actions" and "Security" tabs at the top of the page.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 2:**  In the **"Insights"** tab, find the **"Contributors"** section in the sidebar menu on the left.

H1.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 1:**  Revisit the **"Issues"** tab 📝 to locate the issue you selected earlier.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 2:**  The **“Assignees”** section is on the right side of the issue page.

H1.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 1:**  The **"Issues"** tab 📝 is at the top of the repository page, where you can find all current issues.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints 

**Hint 2:**  Focus on finding the issue that has a **non-contribution code** tag in the title.

H1.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 1:**  Return to the **"Issues"** tab 📝 and **open** the issue you've assigned to yourself.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 2:**  Scroll to the **comment section** at the **bottom** of your issue page to post your introduction.

H1.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 1:**  Use the **"Insights"** tab to view the **"Contributors"** section and choose a one of the **top five** contributors to mention.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 2:** In the issue’s **comment section**, type **"@"** followed by the contributor’s username to tag them.

H1.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 1:** Find and **edit** the **README** file according to the task located in the **issue**.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints 

**Hint 2:**  Once you've finished editing, **commit** your changes and follow through to **create** a **pull request**.

H1.content:
### 💡Hints 

**Hint 2:**  Follow through with the proposed changes by creating a **pull request**.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 2:**  Scroll to the **bottom** of the PR page to add a **comment** requesting a review.  You can **mention** specific individuals or ask any available reviewer for feedback, and remember to be polite and thankful!

H1.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 1:** Go to the **"Issues"** tab 📝 to locate the issue linked to your PR.

H2.content:
### 💡Hints

**Hint 2:** Open the issue and find the **"Close issue"** button, either at the top or bottom of the page. Consider adding a comment to summarize the resolution before clicking "Close."
